description.p: An Approval represents pending or actual authorization information. It specifies what person or discipline is to provide the authorization. The approver or discipline indicates who or what group has authorized or is requested to provide authorization. The effective date indcates when the approval definition was completed. The status indicates if the approval is in-process, approved, disapproved or withdrawn. The approval purpose indicates (optionally) why the approval is being requested/ provided.

explicit.name: approver
explicit.description: the set of organization or persons within organization objects authorizing or requested to authorize the Approval.

explicit.name: discipline
explicit.description:
the functional role required of the approver or what organizational function is required to approve.
A discipline might be 'design engineering', 'manufacturing engineering', 'configuration management', 'checked by', or 'engineering management'.

explicit.name: planned_date
explicit.description: the optional date or date and time when the Approval is to be given.

explicit.name: effective_date
explicit.description: the optional date or date and time when the Approval became effective.

explicit.name: purpose
explicit.description: the optional reason for the Approval. A purpose of an approval might be 'approved for production' or 'approved for prototype'.

explicit.name: status
explicit.description: the state of consent applied to product data.

where.label: WR1
where.description: the approver or discpline shall exist.

where.label: WR2
where.description: the status shall be 'approved', 'dissaproved', 'withdrawn' or 'not yet approved'.

where.label: WR3
where.description: If the status is 'approved', 'dissaproved' or 'withdrawn', the effective_date shall exist.

entity.name: Approval_assignment
entity.description: An Approval_assignment assigns an Approval to product data.

explicit.name: assigned_approval
explicit.description: the Approval to be assigned to product data.

explicit.name: items
explicit.description: the product data to which the Approval is assigned.

entity.name: Approval_relationship
entity.description: An Approval_relationship specifies that two approvals are related. This is a foundation concept which may be refined in other modules. This concept can be used to define sequencing. In its non-refined state, it is used to relate approval instances where one approves and one withdraws that approval.

explicit.name: relation_type
explicit.description: an optional type descriptor for the relationship.

explicit.name: description
explicit.description: an optional description of the relationship.

explicit.name: approval1
explicit.description: the Approval to be related to approval2.

explicit.name: approval2
explicit.description: the Approval to be related to approval1.
